trans-unit.source: Represents an abstraction of an access control entry (ACE) that defines an access rule for a file or directory.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule> class represents an abstraction of an underlying access control entry (ACE) that specifies a user account, the type of access to provide (read, write, and so on), and whether to allow or deny that right.
trans-unit.target: La <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule> classe rappresenta un'astrazione di una voce di controllo di accesso sottostante (ACE) che specifica un account utente, il tipo di accesso per fornire (lettura, scrittura e così via) e se consentire o negare tale diritto.

trans-unit.source: This class can also specify how access rules are propagated to child objects.
trans-unit.target: Questa classe è inoltre possibile specificare come regole di accesso vengono propagate agli oggetti figlio.

trans-unit.source: Use the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule> class to create a new access rule.
trans-unit.target: Utilizzare la <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule> classe per creare una nuova regola di accesso.

trans-unit.source: You can persist the rule using the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> or <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> class.
trans-unit.target: È possibile mantenere la regola utilizzando il <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> o <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> classe.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> class to add and then remove an access control entry (ACE) from a file.
trans-unit.target: Nell'esempio di codice viene illustrato come utilizzare la <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> classe per aggiungere e rimuovere una voce di controllo di accesso (ACE) da un file.

trans-unit.source: You must supply a valid user or group account to run this example.
trans-unit.target: È necessario specificare un utente valido o un account di gruppo per eseguire questo esempio.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> class.
An <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference" /> object that encapsulates a reference to a user account.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights" /> values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType" /> values that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.

Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> class using a reference to a user account, a value that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule, and a value that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.
Use this constructor to create an access control rule that you can persist using the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> or <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> class.
trans-unit.target: Utilizzare questo costruttore per creare una regola di controllo di accesso che è possibile mantenere utilizzando le <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> o <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> classe.

trans-unit.source: Access control rules define user account rights that determine which actions are allowed or disallowed on computers running Microsoft Windows.
trans-unit.target: Le regole di controllo di accesso definiscono i diritti di account utente che determinano quali azioni sono consentite o non consentite nei computer che eseguono Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="identity" /> parameter is not an <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference" /> object.
The <paramref name="identity" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="type" /> parameter.
The name of a user account.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights" /> values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType" /> values that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.

Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> class using the name of a user account, a value that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule, and a value that describes whether to allow or deny the operation.
Use this constructor to create an access control rule that you can persist using the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> or <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> class.
trans-unit.target: Utilizzare questo costruttore per creare una regola di controllo di accesso che è possibile mantenere utilizzando le <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> o <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> classe.

trans-unit.source: Access control rules define user account rights that determine which actions are allowed or disallowed on computers running Microsoft Windows.
trans-unit.target: Le regole di controllo di accesso definiscono i diritti di account utente che determinano quali azioni sono consentite o non consentite nei computer che eseguono Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: The `identity` parameter must identify a valid account on the current computer or domain.
trans-unit.target: Il `identity` parametro deve identificare un account valido nel computer corrente o nel dominio.

trans-unit.source: The string takes the following form, where `DOMAIN` is the name of a valid domain or computer name and `account` is the name of a valid user account on a domain or computer: `DOMAIN\account`.
trans-unit.target: La stringa ha il formato seguente, dove `DOMAIN` è il nome di un nome di dominio o computer valido e `account` è il nome di un account utente valido in un dominio o computer: `DOMAIN\account`.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> class to add and then remove an access control entry (ACE) from a file.
trans-unit.target: Nell'esempio di codice viene illustrato come utilizzare la <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> classe per aggiungere e rimuovere una voce di controllo di accesso (ACE) da un file.

trans-unit.source: You must supply a valid user or group account to run this example.
trans-unit.target: È necessario specificare un utente valido o un account di gruppo per eseguire questo esempio.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="identity" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="type" /> parameter.
An <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference" /> object that encapsulates a reference to a user account.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights" /> values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.InheritanceFlags" /> values that specifies how access masks are propagated to child objects.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.PropagationFlags" /> values that specifies how Access Control Entries (ACEs) are propagated to child objects.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType" /> values that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.

Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> class using a reference to a user account, a value that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule, a value that determines how rights are inherited, a value that determines how rights are propagated, and a value that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.
Use this constructor to create an access control rule that you can persist using the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> or <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> class.
trans-unit.target: Utilizzare questo costruttore per creare una regola di controllo di accesso che è possibile mantenere utilizzando le <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> o <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> classe.

trans-unit.source: Access control rules define user account rights that determine which actions are allowed or disallowed on computers running Microsoft Windows.
trans-unit.target: Le regole di controllo di accesso definiscono i diritti di account utente che determinano quali azioni sono consentite o non consentite nei computer che eseguono Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="identity" /> parameter is not an <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference" /> object.
The <paramref name="identity" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="type" /> parameter.
-or-
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="inheritanceFlags" /> parameter.
-or-
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="propagationFlags" /> parameter.
The name of a user account.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights" /> values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.InheritanceFlags" /> values that specifies how access masks are propagated to child objects.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.PropagationFlags" /> values that specifies how Access Control Entries (ACEs) are propagated to child objects.
One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType" /> values that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.

Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> class using the name of a user account, a value that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule, a value that determines how rights are inherited, a value that determines how rights are propagated, and a value that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.
Use this constructor to create an access control rule that you can persist using the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> or <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> class.
trans-unit.target: Utilizzare questo costruttore per creare una regola di controllo di accesso che è possibile mantenere utilizzando le <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSecurity> o <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectorySecurity> classe.

trans-unit.source: Access control rules define user account rights that determine which actions are allowed or disallowed on computers running Microsoft Windows.
trans-unit.target: Le regole di controllo di accesso definiscono i diritti di account utente che determinano quali azioni sono consentite o non consentite nei computer che eseguono Microsoft Windows.

trans-unit.source: The `identity` parameter must identify a valid account on the current computer or domain.
trans-unit.target: Il `identity` parametro deve identificare un account valido nel computer corrente o nel dominio.

trans-unit.source: The string takes the following form, where `DOMAIN` is the name of a valid domain or computer name and `account` is the name of a valid user account on a domain or computer: `DOMAIN\account`.
trans-unit.target: La stringa ha il formato seguente, dove `DOMAIN` è il nome di un nome di dominio o computer valido e `account` è il nome di un account utente valido in un dominio o computer: `DOMAIN\account`.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="identity" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="type" /> parameter.
-or-
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="inheritanceFlags" /> parameter.
-or-
An incorrect enumeration was passed to the <paramref name="propagationFlags" /> parameter.
Gets the <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights" /> flags associated with the current <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> object.
The <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights" /> flags associated with the current <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> object.
trans-unit.target: Il <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights" /> flag associato all'oggetto corrente <see cref="T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule" /> oggetto.
